oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Powder horn of Taylor Clay Crowder, Co. B, 37th Ky. Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Powder horns were rarely used in the military after the first few months of the war. However, they were used in civilian life into the 20th century. Crowder, from Macon County, Tennessee, served in Co. B, 37th Ky. Inf. Regt., USA. Born in 1847, Crowder is buried in the Vester Crowder Cemtery in Macon County, Tennessee.
